title: Technical Work Plan for revegetation continuation, maintenance, and monitoring projects : USFWS Habitat Restoration Plan 51-06 : Rocky Mountain Arsenal National Wildlife Refuge
name: technical-work-plan-for-revegetation-continuation-maintenance-and-monitoring-projects-usfw-86664
notes: charged with managing wildlife and wildlife habitat, both during and following cleanup of contaminants. This management includes mitigation for damage to existing wildlife habitats due to cleanup activities. Most damages are mitigated under the Terrestrial Restoration Program, an umbrella program for mitigation and restoration of grasslands that is sanctioned by the Remediation Venture Office. Since the beginning of FY 1998, most new habitat restoration projects mitigate the impact of the remediation projects outlined in the Record of Decision and their associated borrow sites. Most pre1997 mitigation efforts centered around damages related to past cleanup activities, particularly Interim Response Actions. Almost all mitigation projects require at least 23 years of initial work, 13 additional years of maintenance, and numerous years of monitoring. This mitigation plan 5106 identifies 65 of those projects needing work beyond the first years efforts.  Plan 5106 proposes to continue initial work on 12 of these projects, provide maintenance if needed on 65 projects, and monitor 15 of them. The objective of this project is to promote i.e., continue or maintain and monitor habitat restoration projects that partially mitigate impacts from a variety of cleanup activities on the Arsenal. Specific objectives for specific projects are described within the original plans for the 66 individual projects.
